title: Shaw Organisation
data: A modern 5-storey shopping mall with a 2-storey annexe block . Currently closed for renovations and will reopen in 2021
A 21-storey office building with a 6-storey retail/ entertainment complex
A 27-storey office building with a 5-storey retail and F & B mall
section_text: Besides its involvement in film distribution , Shaw Organisation had investments in properties [ 5 ] as well . The most prominent one is the Shaw House located at 350 Orchard Road with Isetan as its anchor tenant . The Shaw House is actually the organisation 's largest project to date in Singapore . It took three years to construct and was finally completed in 1993 . Other than the Shaw House , the Shaw Organisation also owns other commercial properties including the Shaw Plaza , Shaw Centre , Shaw Corner , Oriental Plaza , Balestier Warehouse , North Bridge Road Shophouse and Mackenzie Road Shophouse .
intro: Shaw Organisation is a film distribution company and cinema chain founded by brothers Runme Shaw and Run Run Shaw who went to Singapore in the 1920s to expand their family business founded by Runje Shaw. The company originally operated as a distributor for the Shaw brothers' Tianyi Film Company (also called Unique) in Shanghai. Run Run Shaw later moved to Hong Kong in the 1950s to run Shaw Brothers Studio, whilst Runme Shaw stayed in Singapore to continue Shaw Organisation's operations. Unlike Tianyi, Shaw Organisation does not produce films but distribute them in their theatres.
